title: Well, well, well... new record by The Longwalls out today!
excerpt: Well hello there! Been a minute... for all of us. Suffice to say this new Longwalls record — Red Shirts — was ready to go a while back, but then things got complicated. As such, there's a version featuring the original mixes by Brandon and Kurt on short-run, lathe-cut vinyl ( that you can pick up he

title: New Longwalls Coming soon...
New Longwalls music for the 8th Annual JP Music Fest!
excerpt: For your listening pleasure, 2 new tracks from the upcoming Longwalls album entitled Red Shirts . Keep an eye out for an album release in early 2019. And for those who can make it to the JP Music Festival this Saturday, we got some fancy red-tint cassettes/download cards for free! Offer valid while

title: Wow, it's been a minute. But things be percolatin'
excerpt: Hey there! Been a while. Wow. Well, we'll have you know we've been keepin' on with the keepin' on. Here's what's up. For those following along at home, you know it's about time for the annual Kurt von Stetten release. Yep. We're looking at November for the next one. No title yet, but there will be s

title: Kurt von Stetten delivers a "definite must have"
excerpt: The very knowledgable folks at Floorshime Zipper Boots have deemed Kurt von Stetten's "Cycle" a "definite must have." We certainly agree. And at 23 tracks, it's both quant and qual. Star qual to be exact. Dig it! Download: Bandcamp > iTunes > Google Play > Amazon > Static Motor >

title: "Cycle" —23 new tracks from Kurt von Stetten— on sale now!
excerpt: Hey now! It's that time of year. Again. We don't how he does it, we're just happy he does. These 23 new tracks from Kurt von Stetten are quite a trip. Distorted synths and REM jangle cohabitate as Kurt bunnyhops textures, sounds, and moods. Download now Cycle now! Check out the video for Calculator

title: Kurt von Stetten back with new (double!) album entitled "Cycle"
excerpt: Clocking in at an hour plus with 23 tracks, this is a ton of new material from our favorite son, Kurt von Stetten . This new mega release, entitled Cycle , ebbs and flows from track to track, bunny-hopping textures and moods like no other KvS release to date. Fo' reals! Here's the first single, Calc

title: The Longwalls wish you a happy, snowy Sunday!
excerpt: Big thanks to Rob at Sleepover Shows for putting this all together. The song is, of course, " Home " off 2015's Gold Standard . Enjoy!

title: Live video. Kind words. Alan represents The Longwalls at Outlaw Roadshow 2016 this past fall in NYC.
excerpt: Well ain't this a hum-dinger! Alan opens up with "Sargasso in Space" off The Longwalls ' classic 2012 EP, Careers in Science ; follows it up with a tease from the band's forthcoming 6th release with (soon-to-be-blistering) "Red Shirts;" slows things down with "Rukia" from 2015's Gold Standard ; and

title: Kurt von Stetten releases video for "The Future is Fashion" from new album Gutt—on sale now!
excerpt: A new animated video from Kurt von Stetten dropped in our laps last night! It's for the track "The Future is Fashion" of off Kurt's new one, Gutt . It's 20 tracks, it's EPIC, and it's on sale now! Download: here on SMR > Bandcamp > iTunes >

title: The Longwalls' lend to track to "Keep Safe Boston 2016," a benefit compilation for Fenway Health
excerpt: Keep Safe Boston 2016 Compilation For Fenway Health is dedicated in loving memory to all lives affected by the events of June 12, 2016 at Pulse nightclub in Orlando, Florida. The Longwalls are proud to have lent the track " Too Many Prayers " from 2015's Gold Standard to the cause. Stream some track

title: Kurt von Stetten to release new album, Gutt, Friday 10/28
excerpt: Well, well, well. Here we are busy with another Longwalls album, getting into our fall routines and.. oh looky here: A new KvS album called Gutt ! excerpt: The Longwalls ' own Alan Wuorinen is playing a solo acoustic set at the 2016 edition of Outlaw Roadshow NYC . He goes on at 8:30 at the Bowery Electric ! title: The Longwalls to play "Listen Local" 2016 - FREE SHOW!
excerpt: Long weekend, so Sunday night is quite OK for partying. title: Friday night's alright for fighting!

title: A very thoughtful review of "Full Circle - Commonwealth Women Up Front"
excerpt: Discover some new artists. All these singers and bands excel in writing cool, gorgeous songs. They showcase vocal range and musical prowess. Impossible not to listen to it from start to finish again and again and again. Every song impresses with its songwriting, composition and ability to move, soot

title: Friday, April 8: The Longwalls play the Rock & Roll Rumble!
excerpt: The luck of the draw puts The Longwalls on Friday 4/8 for the prelims of the 2016 Rock & Roll Rumble at ONCE Lounge and Ballroom . Get tix here ! title: How about that, The Longwalls are playing in the 2016 Rock & Roll Rumble!
excerpt: As announced last night on Boston Emissions , our very own Longwalls have been selected as one of the 24 bands for the 2016 Rock & Roll Rumble ! Quite the honor we'd say. It was a special night for all who were there and we've worked to try and capture the spirit of that special night back in March when the

title: "Gold Standard" by The Longwalls on sale now!
excerpt: More than a year in the making... we're so very proud to release the new full-length album by Boston's The Longwalls ! After a series of contemplative EPs, Gold Standard , bursts forth with 11 tracks of glorious, fuzzed-out, Americana-infused post-pop. Own it now on limited edition CD or via digital

title: The Longwalls release party for "Gold Standard" set for Saturday, March 7
excerpt: Join The Longwalls on Saturday, March 7 as they celebrate the release of their new full-length album, Gold Standard . title: The Longwalls' "Gold Standard" to be released 2/24!

title: Dan London makes best of 2014 on the Americana Rock Soundoff!
excerpt: Our pal Von has included Dan London on his best of 2014 edition of the Americana Rock Soundoff !. It's a great collection of music and we're proud Dan made the cut. Give a listen and check out Dan's latest— I Will Take You Back —before doing anything else. Ya herd? (And thanks Von!)

title: Dan London's "I Will Take You Back" to be released Tuesday, 11/18
excerpt: We're proud to announce that Longwalls bassist Dan London will release his second solo effort— I Will Take You Back —on Tuesday, November 18. excerpt: The fine folks at Bishop & Rook have written a really nice review of Kurt von Stetten's latest release, " Animals ." excerpt: The fine folks over at Examiner.com and Popa's Tunes have some nice things to say about Animals , the new album by Kurt von Stetten . title: Kurt von Stetten "Animals" out 9/30!
excerpt: It's that time a year again folks! Our own Kurt von Stetten has a new release ready for the fall! It's called Animals and it finds Kurt coloring way outside the lines and conjuring up animals of many different stripes—some strange, some familiar, and all so undeniably human. His 9th record in nearly

title: The Longwalls live on air!
excerpt: And possibly a bit tipsy. Give a listen to WEMF this Saturday afternoon from 4-6pm and hear the mighty Longwalls on The Outlaw Radio Show . They'll be hanging with host extraordinaire Ryan Spaulding and previewing a track or two from their forthcoming new album— The Gold Standard. They'll also be pl

title: Much new music on the way!
excerpt: Making making making. That's what we do! Here's the latest... The new Longwalls album, tentatively titled The Gold Standard, is nearing completion. 11 songs (!) are in the hopper over at Bridge Sound and Stage and we're close to mixing time. Look for a fall release. In the meantime, the new solo alb

title: It's makin' season...
excerpt: The Boston polar vortex will soon yield a bountiful crop of new musics. The Longwalls are deep into the recording of their 5th album at Bridge Sound and Stage . This one is going to be a full-length (first since their debut ) and so far is turning out to be gloriously all over the map. Meanwhile Dan

title: More kind words on KvS' Broken But Not Undone
excerpt: The fine folks at The Dadada have remarked that on Broken But Not Undone , Kurt von Stetten " continues to pump out intriguing, though-provoking low-fi excellence. Fans of GBV take notice ." Just another day of KvS pumping and provoking...

title: Kurt von Stetten is to Boston what Robert Pollard is to Dayton
excerpt: Those aren't our words. Nope. They come from the keyboard of Visions of the Unexcused . And clearly they know what they're talking about. They go on to say that Kurt von Stetten's latest— Broken But Not Undone —manages to be " consistently unique, challenging, and thoroughly rewarding. " High praise

title: KvS' Broken But Not Undone lands in the RSL top 50 for 2013!
excerpt: Ryan's Smashing Life has long been one of, if not the , best music blogs in Boston. So we're pleased as punch that Kurt von Stetten's Broken But Not Undon e has made the blog's best of list for 2013! It's an impressive list; we're proud to be included. Check it out .

title: Meanwhile in Canada....
excerpt: Love is growing for the Kurt von Stetten / Bonnie Trash collaboration! Their first single, Edith , was song of the day on New Lease and featured on Quick Before it Melts . Meanwhile, the fine folks at Grayowl Point wrote, " Edith is rough, loud, and full of energy, and should be a welcome treat to a

title: The Horn reviews KvS' Broken But Not Undone
excerpt: Listen to The Horn ! They know of what they speak, and what they speak is this: Broken but Not Undone (the latest from Kurt von Stetten ) is "deceptively large scale, with soaring dream pop and loud lo fi garage rock... This is an artist worth checking out." We certainly agree! So check it out .

title: WMBR Music Director names KvS' Broken But Not Undone as one of the best of 2013.
excerpt: The very smart, talented, forward-thinking Chris from WMBR has named Kurt von Stetten's latest— Broken But Not Undone —as one of the best of 2013 . He's a Music Director, and it's MIT, so he knows what's he's talking about. Have a listen , and thank you Chris!!

title: Kind words on Broken But Not Undone
excerpt: Alan cross has described "Those That Know," the first track off Broken But Not Undone —the new LP by Kurt von Stetten —thusly, "This song is erratic, insecure, passionate and sweaty all at once. Gloriously chaotic." Wow. We'd say that describes the whole album... it also sorta describes Kurt when he

title: Collaboration time! Kurt von Stetten & Bonnie Trash release first single.
excerpt: Just one week after the release of his latest LP— Broken But Not Undone —our own Kurt von Stetten is back with yet another project. Yikes. The track Edith is the result of a collaboration born on Twitter (!) with Toronto/Guelph-based band Bonnie Trash . Kurt is heavily featured on this first track;

title: Kurt von Stetten live on WMBR
excerpt: We had quite a day yesterday! We launched this new site, release the new Kurt von Stetten album Broken But Not Undone , and capped things off with a short (but sweet) acoustic appearance on WMBR's Pipeline show . Listen to audio of the entire show here (KvS comes on about 14mins in). Big thanks to M

title: Broken, But Not Undone by Kurt von Stetten on sale now! (mostly...)
excerpt: Few things are harder to wrangle in the land of DIY than a firm release date for vinyl. You give ample time, even push back the release date to be safe. And then the test pressings take longer than you'd hoped and two weeks before your release date you're told it'll be another 3 weeks until you get

title: Early love for KvS' Broken But Not Undone
excerpt: One sale today and the early reviews are already in! Floorshime Zipper Boots calls Broken But Not Undone an " altogether perfect record...the singular must have of the fall. " Meanwhile our pal Ryan's Smashing Life says Kurt is " operating on different plane. " High praise for Kurt von Stetten . We'

title: New video from Kurt von Stetten!
excerpt: Video for the first single— Those That Know —off the new Kurt von Stetten album Broken, But Not Undone . Dig it... then question why you ever entertained the notion of going art / music school. Dummy.

title: Broken, but note undone.. the new album by Kurt von Stetten out on vinyl / digital 11/19.
excerpt: We're more than a little excited about this one. Kurt's second of the calendar year, Broken, but not undone is a return to the sort of homemade indie rock that's been lost in the din of quasi-talented folks with way too many tools at their disposal. Yeah, I said it. It's a good one, we promise. #fuc

title: We play the guitar on the MTV...
excerpt: Kurt von Stetten's L.A.R.P (from 2011's Cyclops ), as well as Sargasso in Space and Where Things Go to Fade by The Longwalls (from 2011's Careers in Science ) are all being featured this month on a certain MTV reality show... that will remain nameless. More info here.

title: The love rolls on for Kurt von Stetten's Androlafi
excerpt: More love for Kurt von Stetten's latest, Androlafi ! The Noise calls it " Music that shouts to be heard ." Why thank you. And the lovely folks at Golden Mixtape say it's " An indie delight. " All in a day's work.

title: Kurt von Stetten featured in Vans BMX video!
excerpt: We couldn't be more excited about Vans pairing our own Kurt von Stetten with the amazing BMX rider Dan Sandoval . The track is "He's no Writer" off Kurt's 2011 release, Cyclops . The rest speaks for itself.

title: More love for The Longwalls' Kowloon!
excerpt: " Masterfully blends traditional folk instruments and music with a modern style ." More very kind words on The Longwalls ' Kowloon -- this time from the new Red Line Roots blog !

title: Kurt von Stetten Androlafi UK review.
excerpt: Love from across the pond sounds like this: " Almost taking us back to the very birth of modern guitar music. This is the complete antithesis of so called "manufactured pop". Naturally it'll sell a fraction of what that will, but we'd choose this any day ." That's The Sound of Confusion on Androlafi

title: Kurt von Stetten's Anthropos Elafi video
excerpt: Nice little write-up of Kurt von Stetten's Antrhopos Elafi video (from his latest, Androlafi ) via the fine folks at Beats Per Minute .

title: The kids love Androlafi!
excerpt: For Kurt von Stetten's new album, Androlafi , the word is in. And the word is good. Visions of the Unexcused says, " Listening to von Stetten’s music is like ingesting a dr

title: Kowloon rolls on...
excerpt: A full-moon-sized thank you to everyone who trekked out in the cold Saturday for The Longwalls ' Kowloon release show. Epic night. Much love. We won't soon forget. Meanwhile, kind words on Kowloon continue to roll in. The Noise says the boys " live somewhere between a more rustic Velvet Underground

title: Busy times in Static Motor land!
excerpt: No rest.. we've got The Longwalls CD release show for Kowloon coming up Saturday, January 26! We've also got the release of Kurt von Stetten's new one, Androlafi , coming up Tuesday, February 19th. In addition we've got some song placements coming up on MTV and Dan London is hard at work on his next

title: Love of Kowloon from... Kowloon!
excerpt: We never thought someone born in Kowloon would ever hear the new Longwalls record . Small world, and we're glad the music found him. Thanks to the Ricky from the Panic Manual for his post and recollections.

title: The Longwalls' Kowloon featured on Boston Emissions
excerpt: Big thanks to Anngelle Wood and Boston Emissions for featuring The Longwalls ' Kowloon Sunday night (alongside old pals The Beatings and Black Helicopter ). Stream to the first hour , and check out the full playlist . Radio! Radio!

title: More praise for The Longwalls' Kowloon.
excerpt: "The Longwalls have created a solid album that treats melancholy with a bit of twang, a pinch of grunge and a ton of heart." That's what the fine folks at mxdwn have to say about the new Longwalls record, Kowloon . It's a thoughtful write-up, which we really appreciate. Check it out .

title: We love owls, and The Owl Mag loves Kowloon
excerpt: " The Longwalls evoke wintry discontent and hope springing eternal within the walls of their latest album, Kowloon... a lovely novella of an album. " That's how our friends at The Owl Mag describe Kowloon , the new album by The Longwalls (on sale now). They get it. They really get it. Thanks guys!

title: Twangville loves the Longwalls
excerpt: Big thanks to Twangville for these kind words on Kowloon , the new Longwalls record out 12/4. Over at Twangville they often say the Longwalls are deserving of much wider audience. We couldn't agree more. Help the cause and tell a friend, would ya? Merci.

title: More love for The Longwalls' Kowloon -- on sale today!
excerpt: " At once unsettling, melancholic, and peaceful. Indeed, as the listener reaches the final track a feeling of tranquility has already been delivered ." That's what Boston Music Vibe had to say about Kowloon , the new record from The Longwalls -- on sale today!!

title: Glowing early words on Kowloon!
excerpt: Early reviews are in, and The Longwalls ' latest effort Kowloon seems to be hitting a chord. Our Music Savage writes, " Sonically, it is a sharp sound that sounds like a great direction for the band. " And the fine folks over at Mojophenia write, " The Longwalls capture the sound of a dusty repetiti

title: CD release show for The Longwalls' Kowloon set: Saturday 26 January
excerpt: It's a bit of a tradition around these parts-- CD release shows at the Lizard Lounge in Cambridge. We love that venue, we couldn't be happier The Longwalls are releasing Kowloon there Saturday 26 January , and we love that Glenn Yoder is on board with his CD release that night as well. Gonna be epic

title: KvS and the Vans Downtown Showdown!
excerpt: Wouldn't you know it.. our own Kurt von Stetten's song 50cc's (off the album History ) is featured in this here skate highlights video from the Blueprint Obstacle at the 2012 Vans Downtown Showdown. Damn. Shove it.

title: Kurt von Stetten on Pandora!
excerpt: Pandora listeners— Kurt von Stetten's album Cyclops is now up on Pandora (along with 2009's History ). Easier said then done. Check it out, Kurt makes great radio.

title: Kurt von Stetten is... 16 & Pregnant?!?
excerpt: That's right folks. Our own Kurt von Stetten was featured on last night's episode of MTV's 16 & Pregnant . We told him to use protection. Ha! I funny! What we mean to say is Kurt's song Pangaea —off his 2010 album Pyramid —was featured on last night's episode "Hope" ( watch it here ). Crazy huh? And

title: More love for the Cyclops!
excerpt: Somehow we missed these: Boston's own The Noise recently ran a glowing review of Kurt von Stetten's Cyclops calling it an " aural feast not to be overlooked ." Damn. And the Elusive Little Comments blog can't wait to hear more. Neither can we. Thankfully a new album is already in the works. That's h

title: More praise for Dan London's Happy to See Me!
excerpt: " Sun soaked guitar spiel with Alt-Pop immediacy. File under Ray Davies or Tom Petty. " That's what Mojophenia has to say about Dan London's Happy to See Me . And our friends over at Americana Roots were kind enough to include two tracks on their Americana Rock Mix #132. Good stuff all around.

title: Happy to See Me reviews!
excerpt: A couple nice reviews are in for Dan London's solo debut Happy to See Me . Both involve food— one explicitly , the other (in Dutch!) likely the result of a rather hilarious translation . Oh, and pick up the CD here or name your price for a digital download over at Bandcamp . Enjoy!

title: Hot best of '11 action—Longwalls style!
excerpt: The Longwalls ' Careers in Science album has also landed on a few of best of 2011 lists by the fine folks at The Noise , Twangville , and Beat the Indie Drum ! Thanks to all! Was a good year in SMR land. On to the next.

title: Video: Code of Fisherman by Kurt von Stetten
excerpt: In case you missed it, Kurt von Stetten produced a video for the track Code of Fisherman off his new album Cyclops . Kurt hand painted all the elements before scanning them into his Commadore 64 to get his animation on. Check it!

title: Best of 2011 for KvS' Cyclops *and* Pyramid!
excerpt: Kurt von Stetten's Cyclops has made into a couple of stellar "best of" lists for 2011. Ryan's Smashing Life included both Cyclops and Pyramid on his list and called Kurt a "gifted creator" and a "prolific genius" and Music Savage says "The album deepens with each listen, and I’ve very much enjoyed h

title: Kurt von Stetten's Cyclops is killing it!
excerpt: Early reviews are in from Dysonsound , Music Savage , The Owl Mag , Earmilk , and Migrate Music . It's official, Kurt von Stetten's new album Cyclops is KILLING IT. More soon, when we catch our breath. Phew.

title: Gatsby Lives.. Live!
excerpt: In honor of the 10-year anniversary of Gatsby's first ever show—November 1, 2001—we've put together a collection of live material culled from radio and TV performances between 2001 and 2005. It's truly a blast! We've also launched a Gatsby page over on Bandcamp where you can download both the new li

title: Careers in Science: "Rural America meets the urban streets"
excerpt: The fine folks over at Culture Bomb have some very nice things to say about The Longwalls' Careers in Science Album! Lines like "clash-like rhythms mixed with an Elvis Costello, jangling guitar" make us positively giddy. And we like gumbo. And, we like that we left them wanting more...

title: Careers in Science hangin' around!
excerpt: The Longwalls' album " Careers in Science " is hanging around the Noise local radio chart. The album has been on the charts since April is hanging in there at #15 for August. Big thanks to all the local DJs!

title: BTID hearts (x4!) Careers in Science
excerpt: Matt at Beat The Indie Drum has called The Longwalls' Careers in Science a "start-to-finish power-pop gem." He's really smart, so you should listen to what he has to say! Thanks Matt!

title: Brandon talks Pandora at Music Think Tank
excerpt: Static Motor operator Brandon has written a post talking about his experiences as a DIY label working with Pandora. It's an interesting tale; Music Think Tank even ran it on their front page. It's generated a bunch of interesting comments, check it out! And should you hunger for more, Brandon writes

title: Ingenious, infectious, and practically anthemic!
excerpt: Wow! Some very kind words from The Noise on The Longwalls new album Careers in Science . (Although, we think the CriticTron 3000 needs an upgrade...). Check it out! (scroll..)

title: Two months in the Top 10!
excerpt: Whoa! Two months in the top 10 of the Noise Local Radio Chart for The Longwalls ' Careers in Science ! Big thanks (again) to all the local DJs for spinning the new record!!

title: #7 with a bullett!
excerpt: #7 with a bullet!! The Longwalls' new album Careers in Science has made the top 10 of The Noise local radio chart for the month of April! Huge thanks to our friends at WMBR , WMFO , WFNX , WZLX and all the local DJs for lending your support. You're the best!

title: Thank you!!
excerpt: A HUGE thank you is in order for everyone who came out to The Longwalls' Careers in Science CD release show at Precinct on Friday night. We had a blast, thank you so much! And thanks to Glenn Yoder and Found Audio for coming along for the ride! Good times, more on the way soon...

title: Kurt von Stetten: radio star!!
excerpt: Our own Kurt von Stetten is doing quite well on local radio! In January he cracked the top 10 at WMBR , and recently he's found his way into the top 10 of The Noise montly radio chart for March! Good on ya, Kurt!!

title: New video for The Longwalls' "Ghosts"!
excerpt: The Longwalls have just released a haunting, stop-motion video for the song Ghosts off 2010's Dark Academy EP. Check it out ! The video was produced by our good friend Ryan Murphy , be sure to let him know what you think!! Enjoy!

title: As we suspected—people are loving "Careers in Science"!!
excerpt: " The pure sound of these songs provide such visceral pleasure ." Some very kind words indeed on The Longwalls' Careers in Science from the Boston Globe ! Meanwhile, Oh So Fresh! Music thinks the album is a bit like " modern Springsteen, but with an indie touch ." We'll take it!!

title: Blogging about Careers in Science
excerpt: Curious about The Longwalls' upcoming Careers in Science album?!? Head on over to Alan's blog where he's talking about the thinking behind each song, posting early demos, live recordings, and a few of the final cuts. Some good readin' we reckon..

title: Careers in Science / Longwalls update
excerpt: Hey ya'll! A few things to check out: (1) Brandon's colleague Alex talks about Careers in Science album art design over on the Sametz blog ! (2) Ride the Tempo gave the album a nice 'lil mention . (3) Our pal Dysonsound included us on a guest mix tape for TSURURADIO's Nudiezine ! All good stuff as w

title: Kurt von Stetten's New Year's resolutions!
excerpt: Our own Kurt von Stetten, along with a number of local rock luminaries, offer their New Year’s resolutions to the Boston Globe . Kurt takes a haiku approach.. naturally...

title: Boston Globe—DIY pop powerhouse Kurt von Stetten is on a roll!
excerpt: Our pal Jonathan Perry of the Boston Globe has written a really nice story on Kurt von Stetten and Static Motor. We're beside ourselves with pride. Check it out ! And tell a friend!!

title: Even more love for Kurt von Stetten's Pyramid
excerpt: Our pal Kyle over at Music Savage calls Kurt von Stetten's Pyramid "a fantastic example of an amazing, talented guy who seems to have no limits to what he can do". Kyle is a whole lot smarter than us, so it must be true. (Thanks Kyle!)

title: The Kids Love Kurt von Stetten's Pyramid!!!
excerpt: People are discovering what we've known all along—our own Kurt von Stetten has made a hella great new album. Check out what these fine folks have to say about Pyramid : RidetheTempo | Oh So Fresh! | Perfect Porridge .

title: WMBR spins Aioki!
excerpt: Our pals from WMBR's Pipeline kicked off last night's show with Aioki off Kurt Von Stetten's new album, Pyramid . Radio gold kids, radio gold. Stream the whole show here .

title: The reviews are in for "Pyramid"!!
excerpt: The reviews are in for Pyramid ! Well, the first one anyway. Our pal over at Dysonsound has given Pyramid one hell of a nice writeup. He knows way more about music than we do, so we'll all take him at his word, ok?!?

title: The Longwalls live on WMFO
excerpt: The Longwalls played live On The Town with Mikey Dee at WMFO back in May. The set includes tracks from Field Guide , the new Dark Academy EP, as well as a few new songs set for release on a new EP early next year. Check out parts of the set for free on SoundCloud .

title: The Longwalls Throwback Summer Weekend
excerpt: Join The Longwalls Friday, July 30 at Tommy Doyle's in Hyannis and Saturday, July 31 at the Lizard Lounge in Cambridge for our Throwback Summer Weekend. Unfortunately our main man Kurt von Stetten is on holiday that week, but we're excited to announce that our old pal and Gatsby mate Scott Robinson

title: Have you checked out Kurt Von Stetten's blog?
excerpt: If not, you should. Kurt is busy blogging new songs in preparation for new full-length release!! Lots of manic, new, home-brewed, fuzz-rock is on the way. Check it out.

title: A big thank you!
excerpt: A big thanks is in order for all who came out to The Longwalls' Dark Academy release show at the Lizard Lounge on May 1. It was great night and we're so happy we were able to share it with so many friends--old and new. You guys are the best. On to the next!

title: The Noise loves "Dark Academy"!
excerpt: Boston's own The Noise can't recommend The Longwalls more highly, and says Dark Academy has "all the earmarks of future classic and gets better with every listen." Gee, that's really nice of them. Read it all here (scroll down a bit).

title: Dark Academy looming...
excerpt: The Longwalls ' new EP Dark Academy is in hand and will be available soon here at Static Motor as well as CD Baby, iTunes, and many other fine retail outlets. We also have a release show set for Saturday, May 1 at the Lizard Lounge in Cambridge with the great Cassavettes. More soon so stay tuned, a'

title: The Longwalls Band in Boston
excerpt: An exceptionally badass live performance by The Longwalls is up now at Band in Boston . Go check it out. Now! GO!!!

title: Kind words on Dark Academy
excerpt: Wow, some *very* kind words on The Longwalls ' Dark Academy EP on the Slowcoustic blog . Check it out!

title: Get some indie cred in your twang collection!
excerpt: The fine folks at Twangville have posted a nice review of The Longwalls Dark Academy EP. They think we do a little Jayhawks and mix in a little Shins. But I swear, there ain't no wah-wah anywhere. Haven't used a Wah peddle since 'ought one or so. Anyway, read it here . And if you want to buy it, whi

title: The Longwalls' Zombies! kicks off PopMatters Mixtape
tags: Field Guide for the Zombie Survivalist
excerpt: Nom Nom Nom....PopMatters Mixtape #4 is all about zombies, so who better to kick if off than your Longwalls?!?! It's a great mix, and they even embedded our video. Check it out!!

title: Zombies! Premiere!
tags: Field Guide for the Zombie Survivalist
excerpt: The Longwalls ' Zombies! video premiere with the Plymouth Rock Studios gang is set for Friday, October 30! Details so far: Renting a theatre, showing a bunch of zombie shorts, then the video launch, then chats with video Director & Producer, then Zombieland feature film (!). Plus "new toy" donations

title: More Zombies! bloggage
tags: Field Guide for the Zombie Survivalist
excerpt: Another article on The Longwalls' Zombies! video shoot, and what a fully-functioning Plymouth Rock Studios could mean to their community.

title: Even more Zombies! bloggage
tags: Field Guide for the Zombie Survivalist
excerpt: A nice blog post on The Longwalls' weekend video shoot for Zombies down at Plymouth Rock Studios here . Thanks!

title: All Zombies all the time!
tags: Field Guide for the Zombie Survivalist
excerpt: A great recap of the The Longwalls Zombies! video shoot from Director Louie Jannetty on his blog .

title: Field Guide almost sold out!
tags: Field Guide for the Zombie Survivalist
excerpt: The Longwalls' debut— Field Guide for the Zombie Survivalist — is just about sold out. There's 4 copies (I think!) available on CD Baby , that's about it. If you want the CD, get it now as we probably won't print another batch any time soon.

title: Classic Kurt!
tags: Into the Safety of the Alley
excerpt: Kurt von Stetten's Tree and Into the Safety of the Alley available now for free download!

title: Zombie shoot, great success!
tags: Field Guide for the Zombie Survivalist
excerpt: Thank you thank you thank you to everyone who took part in the The Longwalls' Zombies! shoot this weekend down at Plymouth Rock Studios. The crew (Louie Jannetty Director,Josh Bethoney Producer, and Sean English, Dir. of Photography) were brilliant and amazing (and patient) and all the extras who wo

title: Zombies on the blog
tags: Field Guide for the Zombie Survivalist
excerpt: A nice blog post on The Longwalls' weekend video shoot for Zombies down at Plymouth Rock Studios here . Thanks guys!

title: Zombies are coming!
tags: Field Guide for the Zombie Survivalist
excerpt: The Longwalls video shoot for Zombies starts next Friday night! We'll be shooting Friday night, all day Saturday, and Sunday morning. Gonna be a long weekend but we're pretty excited about it. In preperation for the video, we've just souped up the Zombie track with some new guitar work and some Hamm
